entry.title: Looking for good Big Data, Data Vis and HPC blogs
entry.content:
Last year I moved on from computationally-tinged academic research into straight HPC, but my Google Reader feeds are still largely focused on physics and materials. (Well, and webcomics, and science fiction...) I've added a few feeds related to my new focus, but they've been chosen pretty haphazardly and I don't know if I'm missing out on something awesome or important.

I'm looking for good blogs related to high-performance computing, "Big Data" science, and data visualization. In no particular order, here's what I've got so far:

  • Cluster Monkey
  • Data Wrangling
  • HPC in the Cloud
  • insideHPC
  • HPCwire
  • Marc Hamilton's Blog
  • Cisco High-Performance Networking
  • O'Reilly Radar
  • Fast, Stable, Cheap--Pick One
  • Chart Porn
